awd_titl_txt: Collaborative Research: Conference: 2022 CISE Education and Workforce PI and Community Meetings
awd_abstract_narration:
CISE Education and Workforce (EWF) programs aim to create equitable and inclusive opportunities for computing education and develop a diverse workforce. STARS Computing Corps, a CISE Broadening Participation in Computing Alliance, will support two research community meetings: the CISE EWF Principal Investigator (PI) Meeting and the CISE Research Experiences for Undergraduates Site New PI Workshop.  Both convenings will provide opportunities for the principal investigators  of projects funded by CISE EWF programs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned.

Both the CISE EWF PI meeting and the REU Site New PI workshop will be large events for the Foundation and their respective community, bringing together PIs with representatives from government, academia, and non-profit. For each event, there is a pressing need to meticulously plan and organize agendas, venue and hybrid/remote conference logistics. This grant provides funding for the venue and logistics, including conference registration, audio visual, and meeting space for the hybrid CISE EWF PI meeting. It will also support the remote logistics of the CISE Research Experiences for Undergraduates Site New PI Workshop.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

por.por_cntn:
At NSF, the CISE Education and Workforce (EWF) cluster aimed to create equitable and inclusive opportunities for computing education and to develop a diverse workforce. The goal was to provide opportunities for the principal investigators (PIs) of projects funded by CISE EWF programs to share their research outcomes, promising practices, and lessons learned.

The CISE EWF PI Meeting brought together PIs from the CISE EWF core programs on Broadening Participation in Computing (BPC), Computer Science for All (CSforAll: Research and RPPs), and Computing in Undergraduate Education (IUSE:CUE). 

The project supported the convening of PIs and NSF program officers to advance scientific

research projects funded by the CISE Education and Workforce cluster. The meeting provided

an important and timely opportunity to promote scientific research, reporting on and advancing the theory and practice of broadening participation in computing and for transforming computing education to provide equitable and inclusive opportunities for all to learn computing. Convening PIs with research expertise in computer science, learning sciences, and sociology as well as practitioners in education, this meeting also advanced interdisciplinary discussions that are needed to address complex systemic issues in transforming education and preparing the future computing workforce. 

The programs supported by the CISE EWF cluster integrate research and education, and have a focus on broadening participation of groups that have been historically excluded in computing. As such, the PIs that attended this meeting were able to share project findings and advancing research that directly address these broader impacts. Additionally, the meeting fostered community, building connections and potential collaborations among PIs.

 


Last Modified: 05/31/2024
Modified by: Alan R Peterfreund
